author: pandapip1
content: Withdrawls here wouldn't be affected, as they would effectively scale with the supply

author: arwer13
content:
Hello! I've got a question about withdrawals-devnet-3
It has block gas limit `0x400000 (=4,194,304)`. Why so?
It causes that e. g. some of Aragon contracts cannot be deployed (they require 5m+ gas per tx)
Could it be changed in future devenets? Would it be different in the first withdrawals public testnet?

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: Yeah probably an oversight, we will make sure to increase the gas limit in future devnets

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: The gas limit should be slowly increasing though

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: So you might be able to deploy soon

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: Hmm, my latest block has gas limit 20347473

author: parithosh
content: We can mod the genesis generator tool directly so we start at a higher limit next time, but id have also guessed its higher by now

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: Yep at 30M now, the nodes voted it up

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: I actually like that we're exercising this part of the code, so we should maybe start with a 25M gas limit in the genesis tool

author: barnabasbusa
content: should we do 25 or 30M for the next one ?

author: barnabasbusa
content: OK, will adjust to 25M for genesis then

author: parithosh
content: Yea, we'll mod the genesis tool. Thanks for catching that oversight!

author: parithosh
content: let us know if you want some ether to test stuff in the current devnet, we can send it across.

author: arwer13
content: Okay, thank you. Still have enough.
